{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to [The early innervation of the developing deciduous teeth], ingrowth of dental nerve fibers into the mesenchyme of the tooth-bearing areas of the mouth takes place at a relatively early stage, when the dental laminae are forming but the tooth buds are undeveloped. By the time a developing tooth has reached the cap and bell stages small nerve bundles have begun to enter the mesenchyme from which the dental papilla and sac arise.", "answer_choice": B}
